question: 優しい
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>gentle</kanji>? It's <vocabulary>gentle</vocabulary> (but also <vocabulary>kind</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>warm hearted</vocabulary>).
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: What do people who are <vocabulary>gentle</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>kind</vocabulary> say when someone asks of them a favor? Always "<reading>yessir</reading>" (<ja>やさ</ja>). Always, always "yessir"!
